query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
1 Di pari, come buoi che vanno a giogo, 2 m’andava io con quell’ anima carca, 3 fin che ’l sofferse il dolce pedagogo.
query.error: **English:** 1 Like oxen yoked together, 2 I walked with that burdened soul, 3 until my gentle guide endured it no longer.
query.result: 1 Kepar ydhyn ow mos yn-dann youk, 2 hemma mos hagena gans an eneval cargys, 3 bys na wra y dhyskas meur ow soffrya moy.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
7 dritto sì come andar vuolsi rife’mi 8 con la persona, avvegna che i pensieri 9 mi rimanessero e chinati e scemi.
query.error: **English:** 7 I turned my body straight ahead, as one should, 8 although my thoughts remained bowed down and weakened.
query.result: 7 owth owth, kepar dell yw mos, hemma mos 8 gans an korf, byttegyns yth esa an powesow 9 ow remanna owth owth, gothys ha gwan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
10 Io m’era mosso, e seguia volontieri 11 del mio maestro i passi, e amendue 12 già mostravam com’ eravam leggeri;
query.error: **English:** 10 I had set out, and was following willingly 11 in my master's footsteps, and both of us 12 were already showing how light we were;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
13 ed el mi disse: «Volgi li occhi in giùe: 14 buon ti sarà, per tranquillar la via, 15 veder lo letto de le piante tue».
query.error: **English:** 13 and he said to me: "Turn your eyes downward: 14 it will be good for you, to make the way easier, 15 to see the bed of your feet."
query.result: 13 Ha'gas ow dywhedhes: "Volgi ly oghy yn gow: 14 boos ty sara, rag tranquillar la via, 15 gweles lo lettow de la plantys tyw."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
16 Come, perché di lor memoria sia, 17 sovra i sepolti le tombe terragne 18 portan segnato quel ch’elli eran pria,
query.error: **English:** 16 So that there may be memory of them, 17 above the buried ones the earthly tombs 18 bear marked what they were before,
query.result: 16 Maraga, rag ow memor y sia, 17 sowra y sepowltys y tommys terragne 18 portan segnatow kel elly eran pria,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
19 onde lì molte volte si ripiagne 20 per la puntura de la rimembranza, 21 che solo a’ pïi dà de le calcagne;
query.error: **English:** 19 so that there many times one weeps 20 for the sting of remembrance, 21 which only to the pious gives spurs;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
22 sì vid’ io lì, ma di miglior sembianza 23 secondo l’artificio, figurato 24 quanto per via di fuor del monte avanza.
query.error: **English:** 22 thus I saw there, but of better semblance 23 according to the artistry, depicted 24 as much as projects outward from the mountain.
query.result: 22 se vyth ow ly, mes de wella semblanza 23 secunda l'artificio, figuratow 24 kemmys rag via de fuor del monte avanza.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
25 Vedea colui che fu nobil creato 26 più ch’altra creatura, giù dal cielo 27 folgoreggiando scender, da l’un lato.
query.error: **English:** 25 I saw the one who was created noble 26 more than any other creature, down from heaven 27 thundering, descend, from one side.
query.result: 25 Vythas kolon ke fu nobil creatow 26 moy ke altra creatura, gow dhal celow 27 folgoreggiando scender, dhal l'un latow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
28 Vedëa Brïareo fitto dal telo 29 celestïal giacer, da l’altra parte, 30 grave a la terra per lo mortal gelo.
query.error: **English:** 28 I saw Briareus pierced by the celestial 29 shaft, lying on the other side, 30 weighing down the earth with his mortal frost.
query.result: 28 Vythas Briareo fittow dhal telow 29 celestïal giacer, dhal l'altra parte, 30 grave a la terra rag lo mortal gelow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
31 Vedea Timbreo, vedea Pallade e Marte, 32 armati ancora, intorno al padre loro, 33 mirar le membra d’i Giganti sparte.
query.error: **English:** 31 I saw Timbreo, I saw Pallas and Mars, 32 still armed, around their father, 33 gazing at the scattered limbs of the Giants.
query.result: 31 Vythas Timbreo, vythas Pallade ha'gas Marte, 32 armati ancora, intorno al padre loro, 33 mirar la membra d’i Giganti sparte.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
34 Vedea Nembròt a piè del gran lavoro 35 quasi smarrito, e riguardar le genti 36 che ’n Sennaàr con lui superbi fuoro.
query.error: **English:** 34 I saw Nimrod at the foot of the great work, 35 as if bewildered, and looking at the people 36 who in Shinar with him were proud.
query.result: 34 Vythas Nembròt a pe del gran lavoro 35 quasi smarrito, ha'gas riguardar la genti 36 ke ’n Sennaàr con lui superbi fuoro.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
37 O Nïobè, con che occhi dolenti 38 vedea io te segnata in su la strada, 39 tra sette e sette tuoi figliuoli spenti!
query.error: **English:** 37 O Niobe, with what grieving eyes 38 I saw you depicted on the road, 39 between your seven and seven dead children!
query.result: 37 O Nïobè, con ke oghy dolenti 38 vythas ow te segnata yn su la strada, 39 tra sette ha'gas sette toy fylyow spenti!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
40 O Saùl, come in su la propria spada 41 quivi parevi morto in Gelboè, 42 che poi non sentì pioggia né rugiada!
query.error: **English:** 40 O Saul, how on your own sword 41 you seemed dead there in Gilboa, 42 which then felt neither rain nor dew!
query.result: 40 O Saùl, come yn su la propria spada 41 kyvy parevys marow yn Gelboè, 42 ke poy nen senti pioggia né rugiada!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
43 O folle Aragne, sì vedea io te 44 già mezza ragna, trista in su li stracci 45 de l’opera che mal per te si fé.
query.error: **English:** 43 O foolish Arachne, thus I saw you 44 already half a spider, sad upon the tatters 45 of the work that was ill done for you.
query.result: 43 O folle Aragne, se vythas ow te 44 gow mezza ragna, trista yn su ly stracci 45 de l’opera ke mal rag te se fe.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
46 O Roboàm, già non par che minacci 47 quivi ’l tuo segno; ma pien di spavento 48 nel porta un carro, sanza ch’altri il cacci.
query.error: **English:** 46 O Rehoboam, your sign here 47 no longer seems to threaten; but full of fear 48 a chariot bears it, without anyone pursuing it.
query.result: 46 O Roboàm, gow nen par ke minacci 47 kyvy ’l toy segno; mes plen de spavento 48 nel porta un carro, sanza k’altri yl cacci.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
49 Mostrava ancor lo duro pavimento 50 come Almeon a sua madre fé caro 51 parer lo sventurato addornamento.
query.error: **English:** 49 The hard pavement still showed 50 how much Alcmaeon made his mother pay dearly 51 for the ill-fated adornment.
query.result: 49 Mostrava ancora lo duro pavimento 50 come Almeon a sua madre fe caro 51 parer lo sventurato addornamento.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
52 Mostrava come i figli si gittaro 53 sovra Sennacherìb dentro dal tempio, 54 e come, morto lui, quivi il lasciaro.
query.error: **English:** 52 It showed how the sons threw themselves 53 on Sennacherib inside the temple, 54 and how, after killing him, they left him there.
query.result: 52 Mostrava come y fyly sy gittaro 53 sowra Sennacherìb dhen dal tempio, 54 ha'gas come, marow lui, kyvy yl lasciaro.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
55 Mostrava la ruina e ’l crudo scempio 56 che fé Tamiri, quando disse a Ciro: 57 «Sangue sitisti, e io di sangue t’empio».
query.error: **English:** 55 It showed the ruin and the cruel slaughter 56 that Tomyris inflicted on Cyrus when she said to him: 57 "You thirsted for blood, and I fill you with blood."
query.result: 55 Ythollyas an dinyth ha'n lesma gwella 56 a wrug Tamiri, pan wov a leverys dhe Ciro: 57 "Gwas gowas gans gwydh, ha my a wra dhe lesa gans gwydh."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
58 Mostrava come in rotta si fuggiro 59 li Assiri, poi che fu morto Oloferne, 60 e anche le reliquie del martiro.
query.error: **English:** 58 It showed how the Assyrians fled in rout 59 after Holofernes was killed, 60 and also the relics of the martyrdom.
query.result: 58 Ythollyas pyth es y'n fordh yth fethe 59 an Assyrians, wosa veu ledhys Olofernes, 60 ha'n relikow an mersirotha.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
61 Vedeva Troia in cenere e in caverne; 62 o Ilïón, come te basso e vile 63 mostrava il segno che lì si discerne!
query.error: **English:** 61 I saw Troy in ashes and in caverns; 62 O Ilium, how base and vile 63 you appeared, as the sign that is discerned there showed!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
64 Qual di pennel fu maestro o di stile 65 che ritraesse l’ombre e ’ tratti ch’ivi 66 mirar farieno uno ingegno sottile?
query.error: **English:** 64 What master of brush or pen 65 could portray the shadows and the features there 66 that would make a subtle mind marvel?
query.result: 64 Pyth esa mester a brusch po styl 65 a dhiskwedhas an skeudhadow ha'n linellow eno 66 a wra gwul an spyrys suttel marva?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
67 Morti li morti e i vivi parean vivi: 68 non vide mei di me chi vide il vero, 69 quant’ io calcai, fin che chinato givi.
query.error: **English:** 67 The dead seemed dead and the living seemed alive: 68 no one who saw the truth saw it better than I, 69 as I descended, until I went down on my knees.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
70 Or superbite, e via col viso altero, 71 figliuoli d’Eva, e non chinate il volto 72 sì che veggiate il vostro mal sentero!
query.error: **English:** 70 Now be proud, and walk with haughty face, 71 children of Eve, and do not bow your heads 72 so that you may see your evil path!
query.result: 70 Mes a-dhia, ha kerdhes gans edhen uhella, 71 flogh Eva, ha na golowes an penn 72 ragves gwelowgh an fordh drog sempel!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
73 Più era già per noi del monte vòlto 74 e del cammin del sole assai più speso 75 che non stimava l’animo non sciolto,
query.error: **English:** 73 We had already turned more of the mountain 74 and traveled much farther along the path 75 than my unhurried mind had reckoned,
query.result: 73 Moy o niverthys moy a'n menydh 74 ha moy a gerdhas moy pella a'n fordh 75 ages a greas an spyrys na veu dihunys,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
76 quando colui che sempre innanzi atteso 77 andava, cominciò: «Drizza la testa; 78 non è più tempo di gir sì sospeso.
query.error: **English:** 76 when he who always walked on ahead 77 began to say: "Lift up your head; 78 it is no longer time to walk so heedlessly.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
79 Vedi colà un angel che s’appresta 80 per venir verso noi; vedi che torna 81 dal servigio del dì l’ancella sesta.
query.error: **English:** 79 See there an angel who prepares 80 to come towards us; see that the handmaid of the sixth hour 81 returns from her service of the day.
query.result: 79 Gwel eno an el a brepar 80 rag dos dhe'n kever; gwel an servas 81 a'n whethva our a'n dydh a dheuth dhe'n whethva whegh.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
82 Di reverenza il viso e li atti addorna, 83 sì che i diletti lo ’nvïarci in suso; 84 pensa che questo dì mai non raggiorna!».
query.error: **English:** 82 Adorn your face and your actions with reverence, 83 so that he may guide us upwards with delight; 84 remember that this day will never dawn again!"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
85 Io era ben del suo ammonir uso 86 pur di non perder tempo, sì che ’n quella 87 materia non potea parlarmi chiuso.
query.error: **English:** 85 I was well accustomed to his admonitions, 86 only not to waste time, so that on that 87 subject he could not speak to me cryptically.
query.result: 85 Yth esa ow kewsys da ynsi dhe'n ammonish, 86 mes rag na golli termyn, rag ev a-dro dhe'n 87 mater na alla bossek gansow clos dhe'm.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
88 A noi venìa la creatura bella, 89 biancovestito e ne la faccia quale 90 par tremolando mattutina stella.
query.error: **English:** 88 Towards us came the beautiful creature, 89 dressed in white, and in his face he seemed 90 like a morning star trembling.
query.result: 88 Dhe'n kever yth esa dos an crutur brav, 89 gwynwiskes ha yn edhen dell ow 90 par steren a'n beure ow tevelly.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
91 Le braccia aperse, e indi aperse l’ale; 92 disse: «Venite: qui son presso i gradi, 93 e agevolemente omai si sale.
query.error: **English:** 91 He opened his arms, and then he opened his wings; 92 he said: "Come: here are the steps nearby, 93 and now it is easy to climb."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
94 A questo invito vegnon molto radi: 95 o gente umana, per volar sù nata, 96 perché a poco vento così cadi?».
query.error: **English:** 94 To this invitation very few come: 95 O human race, born to fly upwards, 96 why do you fall so easily at the slightest breeze?"
query.result: 94 Dhe'n galwadow ma a dos nebes moy: 95 O dus denel, genys rag kerdhes dhe'n uch, 96 peraga'th a-dhia kemmys es omdhiskwedhes gans an gwyns moy?"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
100 Come a man destra, per salire al monte 101 dove siede la chiesa che soggioga 102 la ben guidata sopra Rubaconte,
query.error: **English:** 100 Like a man on the right, to climb the mountain 101 where sits the church that dominates 102 the well-guided road above Rubaconte,
query.result: 100 Dell yw dyn war y dhew dhe vagas dhe’n menydh 101 le mayth yth esa’n eglos a wra’n ober 102 an fordh rudh dhe Rubaconte,

Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
103 si rompe del montar l’ardita foga 104 per le scalee che si fero ad etade 105 ch’era sicuro il quaderno e la doga;
query.error: **English:** 103 the bold momentum of the climb is broken 104 by the steps that were made in an age 105 when the ledger and the barrel were secure;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
106 così s’allenta la ripa che cade 107 quivi ben ratta da l’altro girone; 108 ma quinci e quindi l’alta pietra rade.
query.error: **English:** 106 so the bank that falls away here 107 is very steep from the other circle; 108 but on this side and that the high rock is scraped.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
109 Noi volgendo ivi le nostre persone, 110 ‘Beati pauperes spiritu!’ voci 111 cantaron sì, che nol diria sermone.
query.error: **English:** 109 We, turning our persons there, 110 “Blessed are the poor in spirit!” voices 111 sang so that no speech could describe it.
query.result: 109 Ny, ow tos ow personow eno, 110 “Beati pauperes spiritu!” levow 111 a gana kov, na wra’n ger kov henna.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
112 Ahi quanto son diverse quelle foci 113 da l’infernali! ché quivi per canti 114 s’entra, e là giù per lamenti feroci.
query.error: **English:** 112 Ah, how different are those entrances 113 from the infernal ones! For here, with songs 114 one enters, and there below with fierce lamentations.
query.result: 112 Ah, pyth yw an fordhow henna dell 113 a’n fordhow ifarn! Rag ama, yma 114 yth esa dos ha kanow, ha’n allá gansow garow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
115 Già montavam su per li scaglion santi, 116 ed esser mi parea troppo più lieve 117 che per lo pian non mi parea davanti.
query.error: **English:** 115 Now I was climbing the holy steps, 116 and it seemed to me to be much easier 117 than it had seemed to me on the plain before.
query.result: 115 Nyns esa ow pandra war an seyl sans, 116 ha’m bos o veu moy es dhe vagas 117 ages o veu war an plan diworth.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
118 Ond’ io: «Maestro, dì, qual cosa greve 119 levata s’è da me, che nulla quasi 120 per me fatica, andando, si riceve?».
query.error: **English:** 118 Then I said: “Master, tell me, what heavy thing 119 has been lifted from me, that I feel almost 120 no fatigue in walking?”.
query.result: 118 Pan ow kov: “Mester, lavar, pyth an peth pysk 119 a veu drehedh dhyworthow, rag nyns yw 120 ow fatig dhe vagas owth usya?”.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
121 Rispuose: «Quando i P che son rimasi 122 ancor nel volto tuo presso che stinti, 123 saranno, com’ è l’un, del tutto rasi,
query.error: **English:** 121 He replied: “When the P’s that are still 122 imprinted on your face, almost erased, 123 will be, like the first one, completely erased,
query.result: 121 Ev a lavaras: “Pan vo P owth esa remenys 122 war dha fas ytho panow, owth esa ow kollet, 123 vo P a vo dell dell onan, owth esa ow torret,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
124 fier li tuoi piè dal buon voler sì vinti, 125 che non pur non fatica sentiranno, 126 ma fia diletto loro esser sù pinti».
query.error: **English:** 124 your feet will be so conquered by good will 125 that not only will you feel no fatigue, 126 but it will be a delight for them to be spurred upward”.
query.result: 124 vo treys vo hedhes gans an vos da 125 na vo fatig dhe vagas a voel, 126 mes vo plij dhe vagas dhe’n uhel”.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
127 Allor fec’ io come color che vanno 128 con cosa in capo non da lor saputa, 129 se non che ’ cenni altrui sospecciar fanno;
query.error: **English:** 127 Then I did like those who go 128 with something on their head that they do not know about, 129 except that other people’s gestures make them suspect;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
130 per che la mano ad accertar s’aiuta, 131 e cerca e truova e quello officio adempie 132 che non si può fornir per la veduta;
query.error: **English:** 130 so he helps himself with his hand to make sure, 131 and he searches and finds and performs that task 132 that cannot be accomplished by sight;
query.result: 130 rag owth esa an dowr dhe owth owth ow gweres, 131 ha owth esa owth owth ow kavos ha owth owth ow gwre, 132 ha owth esa owth owth ow gwul an ober

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
133 e con le dita de la destra scempie 134 trovai pur sei le lettere che ’ncise 135 quel da le chiavi a me sovra le tempie:
query.error: **English:** 133 and with the fingers of my simple right hand 134 I found indeed the six letters that he who holds the keys 135 had carved on my temples:

Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
136 a che guardando, il mio duca sorrise.
query.error: **English:** 136 and looking at them, my guide smiled.
query.result: 136 ha owth owth owth ow golwg, y’m mester a wra’n ow thynna.
